info.name: PoS
info.description:
# POSTMAN ON STEROIDS

Presentation on Postman advanced features by Sara Tornincasa (Codermine).
This collection includes:
* simple folder
* advanced folder
* collection runs folder
* flows folder
* unit folder

All requests are based on real-life APIs and all tests are taken from real life situations I have encountered in a big project.

exec: pm.response.to.be.ok; // info, success, redirection, clientError,  serverError, are other variants
pm.test("Response can be processed by clients", function () {
pm.response.to.be.json; // assert that the response has any body/a valid JSON body
//There should not be any property called "error" in the response obj
//Every request MUST define in its pre-requests scripts a JSON schema under the name "schema"
//General tests are in the API collection -> "tests" tab
//Specific tests are in the Login folder -> "tests" tab

request.description:
After authenticating, clients call these APIs to get the user's basic info. 
There are many versions of the "load profile" call, we can see one implementation here.

This API is very important: it gets called only once at login, and clients base 90% of their login and UI on this response, so reliability is needed.

response.name: mock | grapeape | may 2

header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

item.description:
After authenticating, the API gateway is able to get customer's id from ongoing session.
In the pre request scripts tab, a simple script lets us choose the current user without having to remember username and password. This is useful when you have a lot of dev/prod users
In the tests tab we check the login response, which is common to both of the login APIs.

item.description:
After authenticating, clients call these APIs to get the user's basic info. 
There are many versions of the "load profile" call, we can see one implementation here.

This API is very important: it gets called only once at login, and clients base 90% of their login and UI on this response, so reliability is needed.

item.description:
Advanced testing and scripting of APIs 
- keeping common controls in a centralized place with no duplicate code
- passing data between APIs

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent
